abstract: Russian lawmakers vote to strip Ilya V Ponomarev, only member of Parliament to oppose Russia's annexation of Crimea, of immunity from prosecution granted to lawmakers; move, seemingly one of political retribution, allows prosecutors to charge Ponomarev in embezzlement case that is expected to result in his conviction and expulsion from Parliament.
lead_paragraph: Russian lawmakers voted overwhelmingly to strip Ilya V. Ponomarev, the only member of Parliament who opposed the annexation of Crimea last year, of the immunity from prosecution granted by the Russian Constitution.

headline.main: Lawmakers Take Step to Remove Putin Critic
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Take Step to Remove Putin Critic

snippet: Russian lawmakers voted overwhelmingly to strip Ilya V. Ponomarev, the only member of Parliament who opposed the annexation of Crimea last year, of the immunity from prosecution granted by the Russian Constitution.
